settings.title: How long will my Shyft DualRide last?
settings.content: The Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ has a 6-year expiration from the date of manufacture. The specific expiration date is listed on the date and model label on the product.

settings.title: Where is the date and model label?
settings.content: You can find the date of manufacture, model name, and model number on two labels on the Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™. One is found on the underside of the infant carrier. The second label is on the underside of the base.

settings.title: How much does the Shyft™ DualRide™ weigh?
settings.content: Include a helpful and informative answer to the frequently asked question here.

settings.title: Is the Shyft™ DualRide™ heavier than other infant car seats?
settings.content: The Shyft™ DualRide™ is a little bit heavier than most infant car seats — but for a good reason! It’s designed to function as a one-piece combo: an infant car seat that opens into a stroller with the wheels and frame already attached. After removing from the base, just squeeze the release on the infant car seat and the stroller wheels drop down, which makes transitioning from the backseat of your vehicle to the sidewalk or driveway seamless. Thanks to this integrated stroller system, you won’t need to carry the infant car seat often. However, the Shyft™ DualRide™ may also be removed from the base without the stroller frame attached, for a lightweight carry option.

settings.title: What are the dimensions of the Shyft™ DualRide™ in stroller mode?
Where is my Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ user guide stored on the product?
settings.content: The user guide for the Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ can be stored on top of the stroller frame, underneath the infant car seat. It is a good idea to always keep your user guide with your car seat so you can refer to this information as needed. Additionally, you may find an electronic copy of your user guide on our website at www.evenflo.com.

settings.text: Share information about your brand with your customers. Describe a product, make announcements, or welcome customers to your store.

settings.title: Does this car seat have cupholders?
settings.content: Yes, a removable cupholder is included for use by the adult in stroller mode ONLY.

settings.title: Does this seat have a tether?
settings.content: No, the Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ does not have a tether. Typically, rear-facing-only car seats do not use a tether as part of the vehicle installation.

settings.title: Does this car seat have a steel frame?
settings.content: The Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ meets or exceeds all applicable Federal motor vehicle safety standards and Evenflo’s internal testing standards. This product does not have a steel frame but is made of robust plastic sufficient to withstand numerous dynamic tests. The Shyft™DualRide™ is engineered to manage crash energy appropriately without the addition of a steel frame.

settings.title: Does this car seat have an anti-rebound bar?
settings.content: The base of the Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ acts as an anti-rebound system — a lot like an anti-rebound bar. This feature absorbs and dissipates crash forces to help provide additional stability.

settings.title: Does this car seat have a load leg?
settings.content: No, the Evenflo Shyft™DualRide™ is not designed with a load leg. This car seat meets or exceeds all applicable Federal motor vehicle safety standards and Evenflo’s internal testing standards. The Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ is engineered to manage crash energy appropriately without the addition of a load leg.

settings.title: Is the Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ latex-free?
settings.content: Yes. All Evenflo car seats are latex-free.

settings.title: Is the buckle cover required?
settings.content: No. The buckle cover for your Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ is optional and provided for your child’s comfort. It may be used at any time.

settings.title: Which models include SensorSafe™?
settings.content: All versions of the Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ come equipped with SensorSafe™.

settings.title: How many buckle positions does this car seat have?
settings.content: The Evenflo Shyft™DualRide™ has 3 buckle positions. The buckle should be positioned as close as possible to, without being under, your child’s bottom. You may also shorten the buckle to improve fit for newborns.

settings.title: Is the body pillow required?
settings.content: The infant body pillow is required for our tiniest riders from 3 - 6 lb. (1.4 - 2.7 kg). It is optional for use above 6 lb. (2.7 kg) and is designed to assist with your child’s positioning and comfort.

settings.title: How many carry handle positions does the Evenflo ShyftTM DualRideTM have?
settings.content: The Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ has 3 handle positions. Any locked handle position may be used in your vehicle, in the United States. The handle must be in the upright position to carry your infant car seat.

settings.title: How many harness height positions are on this car seat?
settings.content: The Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ has 8 harness positions. To adjust the harness height, simply squeeze the harness height adjustment at the top of the headrest and move the headrest up or down to the appropriate location for your child.

settings.title: Can you use this car seat without the base?
settings.content: Yes, the Shyft™ DualRide™ can be used with or without the stroller frame when installing without the base.

settings.title: Will this car seat fit my child?
settings.content:
The Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ has been designed to fit a wide range of children. The information provided in the table below should help you determine if it is the right fit for your child.

Rear-facing weight range: 3 - 35 lb. (1.4 – 15.8 kg)

Rear-facing height range: 15.7 - 32 in (40 - 81 cm)

Rear-facing minimum age: birth

Lowest harness position (with infant insert): 4.5 in (11.4 cm)

Highest harness position: 11.5 in (29.2 cm)

Inner buckle position: 3 in (7.6 cm)

Middle buckle position: 4 in (10.2 cm)

Outer buckle position: 5 in (12.7 cm)

settings.title: Is it okay for my child’s feet to touch the vehicle seat back when in rear-facing mode?
settings.content: Yes. The Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ is designed to accommodate children in rear-facing mode until they are 32 in/81 cmtall or weigh 35 lb./15.8 kg.and the top of their head is at least 1 in (2.5 cm) below the top of the headrest. It is okay for your child’s feet to touch the back of the vehicle seat.

settings.title: How long will my child be able to use their infant car seat?
settings.content: The Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ can be used until the child reaches either 35 lbs. (15.8 kg), 32 inches (81 cm), or the top of their head is less than 1 inch (2.5 cm) below the top of the headrest. Once your child reaches any of these three measurements, they will need to transition to a convertible or all-in-one car seat in rear-facing mode.

settings.title: What are the different ways you can use the ShyftTM DualRideTM?
settings.content: The Shyft™ DualRide™ is a versatile infant car seat and stroller combo with multiple modes: it’s an infant car seat with the base (stroller’s wheels remain attached to the base), it’s a stroller, it’s an infant carrier with the stroller wheels attached, and it’s an infant carrier without the stroller wheels attached. In your vehicle, you can install the Shyft™ DualRide™ with the base with either lower anchors or the vehicle seat belt. You can also install the Shyft™ DualRide™ without the base using the vehicle seat belt. Without the base, the Shyft™ DualRide™ can be installed with or without the stroller frame.

settings.title: Is Shyft™ DualRide™ approved for use on aircraft?
settings.content: The Shyft™ DualRide™ is approved for use on an aircraft with the stroller wheels attached to the infant carrier. The base may not be used for installation on the aircraft. Please check with your airline before departure to make sure this car seat meets all requirements, including a minimum of 18 in. (45.7 cm) aisle width for use in stroller mode and a minimum of 18 in. (45.7 cm) aircraft seat width.

settings.title: Can I use this car seat on an aircraft?
settings.content: Yes, the Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ can be installed on an aircraft without the use of the base. NOTE: If the car seat is equipped with SensorSafe™, tighten the harness around your child and then unfasten the chest clip. In order to comply with the FAA regulation for Portable Electronic Devices, the SensorSafe™ chest clip must remain unfastened during take-off and landing.

settings.title: Where can I find the sticker stating that my car seat is FAA approved?
settings.content: You can locate your car seat’s FAA compliance label underneath the infant carrier.

settings.title: Does this car seat fit into a travel bag?
settings.content: Yes, it fits in the Evenflo travel bag which can be purchased separately.

settings.title: What’s the best way to travel with Shyft™ DualRide™ on an airplane?
settings.content: If you plan to use your car seat without the base on an aircraft, look for the label on the car seat stating that it is aircraft approved. There is also information in the user guide that states the Shyft™ DualRide™ is aircraft approved to be used without the base. You do not need to print or bring any additional information to use your car seat on an aircraft, however, it is a good practice to contact your airline prior to departure to make sure the car seat requirements for use on an aircraft, provided in your user guide, will be met.IIf you plan to use your car seat without the base on an aircraft, look for the label on the car seat stating that it is aircraft approved. There is also information in the user guide that states the Shyft™ DualRide™ is aircraft approved to be used without the base. You do not need to print or bring any additional information to use your car seat on an aircraft, however, it is a good practice to contact your airline prior to departure to make sure the car seat requirements for use on an aircraft, provided in your user guide, will be met.

settings.title: Can I use the Shyft™ DualRide™ for international travel?
settings.content: If you plan to fly internationally, ALWAYS check with the airline prior to departure to make sure the car seat requirements for use on an aircraft, provided in your user guide, will be met. The aircraft certification for the Shyft™ DualRide™ is only relevant for US or Canadian airlines that fall under the provisions of the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) or Transport Canada (TC). International airlines may not allow car seat use on their aircraft or may have seating systems incompatible with your Shyft DualRide. Additionally, vehicles in other countries also meet different regulatory standards and may not have seating systems that are compatible with this car seat.

settings.title: Can I purchase an airline ticket for my Shyft™ DualRide™?
settings.content: If you plan to use the Shyft™ DualRide™ on an aircraft for a child that is less than 2 years old, you must purchase a ticket for your child. You should contact the airline prior to departure to make sure the car seat requirements for use on an aircraft, provided in your user guide, will be met.

settings.title: The handle of my Shyft™ DualRide™ will not extend. What should I do?
settings.content: The Shyft™ DualRide™ handle will only extend when it is rotated into stroller mode. To rotate the handle, press both white buttons on the side of the handle and rotate the handle into stroller mode (towards your child’s feet). Then to extend the handle, press the white button in the center of the handle and pull the handle towards you.

settings.title: The handle of my Shyft™ DualRide™ won’t rotate back into the carry position. What should I do?
settings.content: Your Shyft™ DualRide™ handle will only rotate when the handle is secured in the lowest locked position. Make sure the handle is fully locked into the shortest position (no silver should be showing near the sides of the handle grip). Once the handle is fully locked in place, you should be able to rotate the handle by pressing both white buttons on the side of the handle and pushing the handle to the upright carry position.

settings.title: Can I fold and unfold the Shyft™ DualRide™ with the baby inside?
settings.content: Include a helpful and informative answer to the frequently asked question here.

settings.title: Is the harness system removable or replaceable if my baby makes a mess?
settings.content: The harness system of the Shyft™ DualRide™ is not replaceable and may not be removed from the car seat. However, the harness is easy to spot clean as needed using mild soap and warm water. For stubborn messes, a soft-bristle toothbrush may help with scrubbing. Take care not to soak the harness. The harness should then air dry.

settings.title: How do the Shyft™ DualRide™ brakes work?
settings.content: Your Shyft™ DualRide™’s rear wheels include a braking system for stroller mode. You’ll find one flip-flop-friendly brake on each rear wheel. You must press down on both brake pedals to fully lock the wheels against rolling. To release the brake, lift up on the brake pedal for each rear wheel. For safety, ALWAYS use the brakes when placing your child in or removing your child from the stroller — and ALWAYS check that both brakes are fully engaged.

settings.title: The wheels of my Shyft™ DualRide™ won’t move. What's wrong?
settings.content: If the wheels of your Shyft™ DualRide™ aren’t turning, double-check that both rear wheel brakes have been disengaged. To release the brake, lift up the brake pedal for each rear wheel. For safety, ALWAYS make sure both brakes are fully engaged when placing your child in or removing your child from the car seat.

settings.title: What parts can be replaced on the Shyft™ DualRide™?
settings.content: The following parts may be replaced if needed: buckle cover, harness cover, seat pad, canopy, infant insert, front and rear wheels, wheel wells, stroller frame, cup holder, and cup holder clip. Replacement parts may be ordered at parts.evenflo.com or by contacting ParentLink from 8 am to 5 pm EST, Monday through Friday at 1-800-233-5921 (US) or 937-773-3971 (Canada).

settings.title: Why won’t my Shyft™ DualRide™ click into the base?
settings.content: If you’re having trouble getting your Shyft™ DualRide™ infant carrier with the stroller frame to click into your car seat base, make sure your stroller wheels with the stroller frame are properly folded and both wheels are aligned in an upright position. You may need to remove the infant carrier with the stroller frame, then unfold and refold the stroller wheels. Additionally, double-check the central front adjuster (CFA) strap between your child’s legs to make sure it is not blocking the connection to the base. An elastic loop is provided at the end of this strap so you can roll it up for out-of-the-way storage.

settings.title: How do I know when the infant carrier with the frame is secure in the base?
settings.content: Listen for the tell-tale ‘click’ that lets you know your car seat base and infant carrier with stroller frame are fully attached — and ALWAYS lift up on the carrier handle to check that it’s secure. If you are having difficulty connecting your Shyft™ DualRide™ to the base, you may need to double-check that the stroller wheels are properly folded. Remove the infant carrier with the stroller frame, then unfold and refold your wheels, and try clicking into the base again. Also, be sure to double-check the central front adjuster (CFA) strap between your child’s legs to make sure it is not blocking the connection to the base. An elastic loop is provided at the end of this strap so you can roll it up for out-of-the-way storage.

settings.title: How do I know when to change the waist strap position for my baby?
settings.content: Include a helpful and informative answer to the frequently asked question here.

settings.title: How do I know the recline is correct for my baby?
settings.content: Look for the bubble indicator at the top of your Shyft™ DualRide™’s infant car seat base. The bubble must be in the blue zone at all times to ensure that your child is properly positioned. To adjust the base to the correct position for your child, squeeze the recline handle and raise or lower the recline foot.

settings.title: Where do I check to make sure I have a tight install?
settings.content: Firmly grip the car seat near the belt path opening, which is where you have it installed. Try to move the car seat from side to side and front to back. The car seat should not move more than one inch (2.5 cm). If it moves more than one inch at the belt path, try your installation again. If it still moves more than one inch you may need to change seating positions in your vehicle or try a different installation method.

settings.title: How do I know if my car seat is tightly installed?
settings.content: When checking for a tight installation, it is important to test the car seat right where you have it installed in the vehicle. For a rear-facing car seat, that means you will grab the car seat near your child's feet and not near their head. For an infant car seat secured with the base, make sure you test for tightness by grabbing the belt path on the base (not the infant carrier). If you have installed

settings.title: Can I install the Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ in the center seat of my vehicle?
settings.content: Yes, the Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ can be used in any forward-facing vehicle seating position allowed in your vehicle’s owner’s manual, as long as a tight installation can be achieved. Therefore, the center seating position may be an option. However, in some vehicles, the center seating position may be narrower which could make it more difficult to tightly install your car seat. In many vehicles, the center seating position may not allow installation with lower anchors. It is important to refer to both your vehicle owner's manual and your car seat user guide for full installation details.

settings.title: If I have both this car seat and a second car seat, will there be enough room to fit a third passenger in my backseat?
settings.content: There are many combinations of vehicle makes, models, car seat configurations, vehicle seat belt designs, and seat cushion shapes. The easiest way to determine whether your car seat is suitable for a particular seating position is to check for a tight installation, especially when trying to fit multiple passengers in the back seat of your vehicle. Unfortunately, some smaller sedans and SUVs have rear seat belt systems that overlap, which makes it very difficult to fit three passengers in the rear seat.

settings.title: Can I use a pool noodle or towel if I need more recline?
settings.content: Yes, in certain situations. The base of the Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ has 5 recline positions for rear-facing installations. There is a bubble level indicator on the top of the base; the bubble must be in the blue zone. Try to use the recline foot first to achieve the correct recline in your vehicle. If more reclining is needed, store the recline foot, and then tightly roll a towel or use a section of pool noodle underneath the base near the vehicle seat back to increase the recline angle, if necessary. You may also use the rolled towel or pool noodle if you are installing the infant carrier without the base.

settings.title: Can I use the LATCH/UAS system?
settings.content: Absolutely! The Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ comes equipped with QuickConnectors for a simple and secure installation. There is no weight limit for lower anchor use. You may install your Shyft™ DualRide™ using either the lower anchors or the vehicle seat belt.

settings.title: Does this car seat come with a seat protector pad?
settings.content: No, but we do have an accessory mat available at www.evenflo.com. You can also place a towel beneath and behind the car seat to help protect your vehicle upholstery.

settings.title: Can I use a car seat mat to protect my vehicle seat?
settings.content: Evenflo allows the use of the Evenflo car seat accessory mat underneath the Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ in all installation modes. You can also place a towel beneath and behind the car seat to help protect your vehicle upholstery.

settings.title: Can you wash the seat pad? If so, how?
settings.content: Yes! For your convenience, the soft goods on your Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ are washable. This includes the seat pad, head pad, infant insert, harness covers, and buckle cover. Machine wash separately in cold water on a delicate cycle. Do not use chlorine bleach. Tumble dry on low heat for 10 – 15 minutes. Do not iron or dry clean. See product instructions for full cleaning details.

settings.title: How do you clean the plastic components of the car seat or base?
settings.content: Include a helpful and informative answer to the frequently asked question here.

settings.title: How easy is it to remove the seat pad to wash?
settings.content: Really simple. The seat pad is designed to be easy-to-remove and toss in the wash (just be sure to wash separately, delicate cycle, with mild detergent).

settings.title: Does the black fabric get hot in the summer?
settings.content: Like all black fabrics, the black fabric on your car seat will get warmer the longer the car seat is exposed to sunlight. In warmer months, you can place a towel or sheet over the car seat when it is not in use to help keep it cool.

settings.title: How comfortable are the fabrics for my child?
settings.content: The Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ is designed with premium, soft fabrics that have a smooth finish for easy spot cleaning. Your child will love the plush feel.

settings.title: What standards does this car seat meet?
settings.content: The Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ meets or exceeds all applicable Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standards (FMVSS) and Canadian Motor Vehicle Safety Standards (CMVSS). In addition, this infant car seat meets the Consumer Product Safety Commission standard for handheld infant carriers.

settings.title: If car seats are required by government regulation to be flame-retardant, how does Evenflo make sure it meets the government standard?
settings.content: Flammability testing of car seats is required under the FMVSS 302, Flammability of Interior Materials Standard. The test measures the rate of flame spread with the goal of maximizing the amount of time a caregiver would have to remove an occupant from the car seat in the event of a vehicle fire. Evenflo’s car seats are tested by an accredited independent testing laboratory and meet the FMVSS 302 standard. In addition, Evenflo car seats are tested for toxicity to meet or exceed the regulations of various state and federal child products banned substances laws and regulations.

settings.title: How is this car seat tested?
settings.content: At Evenflo, we go above and beyond government standards to create car seats that are safe. The Evenflo Shyft™ DualRide™ meets or exceeds all applicable federal safety standards. It is structural integrity tested at energy levels approximately 2x the federal crash test standard, additionally, it is side impact tested, rollover tested, and temperature tested.
